meanings.definition: Having or showing practical knowledge and experience
meanings.sent1: She is the savviest person in our group when it comes to fixing things.
meanings.sent2: He is considered one of the savviest investors in the industry.
meanings.sent3: The savviest shopper always finds the best deals in town.
meanings.sent4: Her savviest move was to negotiate a better salary for herself.
meanings.sent5: The savviest decision he made was to start his own business.

meanings.sent1: I finally savviest the instructions after reading them multiple times.
meanings.sent2: She quickly savviest the concept after the teacher explained it.
meanings.sent3: He savviest the joke only after his friend explained it to him.
meanings.sent4: She savviest the situation and knew exactly what to do.
meanings.sent5: After a while, he savviest the importance of time management.

meanings.sent1: I savviest that you prefer tea over coffee.
meanings.sent2: She savviest the risks involved in the project.
meanings.sent3: He savviest the plot twist before it was revealed.
meanings.sent4: They savviest the rules of the game and played strategically.
meanings.sent5: After the explanation, she savviest the reasons behind the decision.

meanings.sent1: I savviest of the changes in the schedule.
meanings.sent2: She savviest about the upcoming event.
meanings.sent3: He savviest of the latest trends in technology.
meanings.sent4: They savviest of the potential risks involved.
meanings.sent5: After the meeting, she savviest of the new company policies.
